snippet: Senators of both parties challenged the collection of records of domestic phone calls, as the latest leak provided new details on the way the agency monitors Web browsing around the world.
abstract: Senators of both parties use Senate Judiciary Committee hearing to sharply challenge National Security Agency's domestic call log program; momentum against the program appears to be building, as details from latest leak make it clear program operates on a very large scale, collecting huge amounts of data from Americans' calling records and from around the world on the Internet.

byline.original: By CHARLIE SAVAGE and DAVID E. SANGER

lead_paragraph: Senators of both parties challenged the collection of records of domestic phone calls, as the latest leak provided new details on the way the agency monitors Web browsing around the world.

headline.main: Senate Panel Presses N.S.A. on Phone Logs
headline.print_headline: Senate Panel Presses N.S.A. On Phone Logs
